alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield; Lexington; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 5:23PM EDT until April 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Southwestern Lexington County in central South Carolina... Northeastern Aiken County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Saluda County in central South Carolina... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 523 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ridge Spring, or 12 miles southwest of Batesburg-Leesville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Aiken, Lexington, Batesburg-Leesville, Red Bank, South Congaree, Ridge Spring, Aiken Municipal Airport, Pelion, Gilbert, Summit, Monetta, Bundrick Island, Murray, Camp Kinard, New Holland, Samaria Fire Station, Cedar Pond Campground, Lexington County Airport At Pelion, Fredonia and Peachtree Rock. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 19 and 57. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central South Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Conditions are favorable for tornadoes to form, sometimes with little or no advance warning. Move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
